00003 package Parser::Context;
00004 my $pkg = "Parser::Context";
00005 use strict; no strict "refs";
00006 our @ISA = ("Value::Context");
00007 
00008 #
00009 #  Create a new Context object and initialize its data lists
00010 #
00011 sub new {
00012   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00013   my $context = $Value::defaultContext->copy;
00014   bless $context, $class;
00015   $context->{parser} = {%{$Parser::class}};
00016   push(@{$context->{data}{values}},'parser');
00017   $context->{_initialized} = 0;
00018   my %data = (
00019     functions => {},
00020     variables => {},
00021     constants => {},
00022     operators => {},
00023     strings   => {},
00024     parens    => {},
00025     lists     => {},
00026     flags     => {},
00027     reduction => {},
00028     @_
00029   );
00030   $context->{_functions} = new Parser::Context::Functions($context,%{$data{functions}});
00031   $context->{_variables} = new Parser::Context::Variables($context,%{$data{variables}});
00032   $context->{_constants} = new Parser::Context::Constants($context,%{$data{constants}});
00033   $context->{_operators} = new Parser::Context::Operators($context,%{$data{operators}});
00034   $context->{_strings}   = new Parser::Context::Strings($context,%{$data{strings}});
00035   $context->{_parens}    = new Parser::Context::Parens($context,%{$data{parens}});
00036   $context->{_reduction} = new Parser::Context::Reduction($context,%{$data{reduction}});
00037   $context->lists->set(%{$data{lists}});
00038   $context->flags->set(%{$data{flags}});
00039   $context->{_initialized} = 1;
00040   $context->update;
00041   return $context;
00042 }
00043 
00044 #
00045 #  Update the token pattern
00046 #
00047 sub update {
00048   my $self = shift; return unless $self->{_initialized};
00049   my @patterns = ([$self->{pattern}{number},-10,'num']);
00050   my @tokens;
00051   foreach my $name (@{$self->{data}{objects}}) {
00052     my $data = $self->{$name};
00053     foreach my $pattern (keys %{$data->{patterns}}) {
00054       my $def = $data->{patterns}{$pattern};
00055       $def = [$def,$data->{tokenType}] unless ref($def) eq 'ARRAY';
00056       push @patterns,[$pattern,@{$def}];
00057     }
00058     push @tokens,%{$data->{tokens}};
00059   }
00060   $self->{pattern}{type} = [];
00061   $self->{pattern}{tokenType} = {@tokens};
00062   push @patterns,[getPattern(keys %{$self->{pattern}{tokenType}}),0,''];
00063   @patterns = sort byPrecedence @patterns;
00064   foreach my $pattern (@patterns) {
00065     push @{$self->{pattern}{type}}, $pattern->[2];
00066     $pattern = $pattern->[0];
00067   }
00068   my $pattern = '('.join(')|(',@patterns).')';
00069   $self->{pattern}{token} = qr/$pattern/;
00070 }
00071 
00072 #
00073 #  Build a regexp pattern from the characters and list of names
00074 #  (protect special characters)
00075 #
00076 sub getPattern {
00077   my $single = ''; my @multi = ();
00078   foreach my $x (sort byName (@_))
00079     {if (length($x) == 1) {$single .= $x} else {push(@multi,$x)}}
00080   foreach my $x (@multi) {$x = protectRegexp($x) unless substr($x,0,3) eq '(?:'}
00081   my @pattern = ();
00082   push(@pattern,join('|',@multi)) if scalar(@multi) > 0;
00083   push(@pattern,protectRegexp($single)) if length($single) == 1;
00084   push(@pattern,"[".protectChars($single)."]") if length($single) > 1;
00085   my $pattern = join('|',@pattern);
00086   $pattern = '^$' if $pattern eq '';
00087   return $pattern;
00088 }
00089 
00090 sub protectRegexp {
00091   my $string = shift;
00092   $string =~ s/[\[\](){}|+.*?\\]/\\$&/g;
00093   return $string;
00094 }
00095 
00096 sub protectChars {
00097   my $string = shift;
00098   $string =~ s/([\^\]])/\\$1/g;
00099   $string =~ s/^(.*)-(.*)$/-$1$2/g;
00100   return $string;
00101 }
00102 
00103 #
00104 #  Sort names so that they can be joined for regexp matching
00105 #  (longest first, then alphabetically)
00106 #
00107 sub byName {
00108   my $result = length($b) <=> length($a);
00109   $result = $a cmp $b unless $result;
00110   return $result;
00111 }
00112 #
00113 #  Sort by precedence, then type
00114 #
00115 sub byPrecedence {
00116   my $result = $a->[1] <=> $b->[1];
00117   $result = $a->[2] cmp $b->[2] unless $result;
00118   $result = $b->[0] cmp $a->[0] unless $result;
00119   return $result;
00120 }

00124 #
00125 #  Access to the data lists
00126 #
00127 sub operators {(shift)->{_operators}}
00128 sub functions {(shift)->{_functions}}
00129 sub constants {(shift)->{_constants}}
00130 sub variables {(shift)->{_variables}}
00131 sub strings   {(shift)->{_strings}}
00132 sub parens    {(shift)->{_parens}}
00133 sub reduction {(shift)->{_reduction}}
00134 
00135 sub reduce     {(shift)->{_reduction}->reduce(@_)}
00136 sub noreduce   {(shift)->{_reduction}->noreduce(@_)}
00137 sub reductions {(shift)->{_reduction}}

00139 #
00140 #  Store pointer to user's context table
00141 #
00142 my $userContext;
00143 
00144 #
00145 #  Set/Get the current Context object
00146 #
00147 sub current {
00148   my $self = shift; my $contextTable = shift; my $context = shift;
00149   if ($contextTable) {$userContext = $contextTable} else {$contextTable = $userContext}
00150   if (defined($context)) {
00151     if (!ref($context)) {
00152       my $name = $context;
00153       $context = Parser::Context->getCopy($contextTable,$context);
00154       Value::Error("Unknown context '%s'",$name) unless defined($context);
00155     }
00156     $contextTable->{current} = $context;
00157     $Value::context = \$contextTable->{current};
00158   } elsif (!defined($contextTable->{current})) {
00159     $contextTable->{current} = $Parser::Context::Default::context{Numeric}->copy;
00160     $Value::context = \$contextTable->{current};
00161   }
00162   return $contextTable->{current};
00163 }
00164 
00165 #
00166 #  Get a copy of a named context
00167 #   (either from the (optional) list provided, the main user's list
00168 #    or from the default list)
00169 #
00170 sub getCopy {
00171   my $self = shift; my $contextTable;
00172   $contextTable = shift if !defined $_[0] || ref($_[0]) eq 'HASH';
00173   $contextTable = $userContext unless $contextTable;
00174   my $name = shift; my $context = $contextTable->{$name};
00175   $context = $Parser::Context::Default::context{$name} unless $context;
00176   return unless $context;
00177   $context = $context->copy;
00178   $context->{name} = $name;
00179   return $context;
00180 }
00181 
00182 #
00183 #  Obsolete:  use "getCopy" instead
00184 #
00185 sub get {shift->getCopy(@_)}

00187 #
00188 #  Update the precedences of multiplication so that they
00189 #  are the standard or non-standard ones, depending on the
00190 #  argument.  It should be 'Standard' or 'Non-Standard'.
00191 #
00192 sub usePrecedence {
00193   my $self = shift;
00194   for (shift) {
00195 
00196     /^Standard/i  and do {
00197       $self->operators->set(
00198         ' *' => {precedence => 3},
00199         '* ' => {precedence => 3},
00200         ' /' => {precedence => 3},
00201         '/ ' => {precedence => 3},
00202          fn  => {precedence => 7.5},
00203          ' ' => {precedence => 3},
00204       );
00205       last;
00206     };
00207 
00208     /^Non-Standard/i and do {
00209       $self->operators->set(
00210         ' *' => {precedence => 2.8},
00211         '* ' => {precedence => 2.8},
00212         ' /' => {precedence => 2.8},
00213         '/ ' => {precedence => 2.8},
00214          fn  => {precedence => 2.9},
00215          ' ' => {precedence => 3.1},
00216       );
00217       last;
00218     };
00219 
00220     Value::Error("Precedence type should be one of 'Standard' or 'Non-Standard'");
00221   }
00222 }
